title: Meet The Karamojong
content: I've been going to Africa for 10 years  and I'd never seen anything like this The Karamajong were once a nomadic people  from Ethiopia but now they've settled in the mountainous region of northeastern Uganda.  Because of their violent tendencies, they're not the easiest people to reach. Their dwellings  are built for defense with small doorways that you have to crawl down to get through and large  walls that are built not so much to keep people out but if they do get over the wall to trap them  inside. Karamajong men have multiple wives with many children. They collect cattle not so much  to feed their families but as a status symbol. Their religion is that of superstition, idolatry,  ancestor worship and sacrifice. They believe in many curses that have been pronounced upon them  and the only way to remove the effects of those curses is to sacrifice an animal in the center of  their village. It may seem like a daunting task to try to reach a group of over one million  people that are so steeped in paganism...but just imagine telling them of a sacrifice  that could take away all of their sins.

They believe in many curses that have been pronounced upon them  and the only way to remove the effects of those curses is to sacrifice an animal in the center of  their village.
